content.detailedDescription: It was about 9:30 pm on 12/31/2013 i was driving home from getting dinner with my wife when i look out my window to the east and saw a bright orange light it caught my attention because it was bigger then a star it was round and glowing as i keep looking at it i notice it didn't move and had no blinking lights like an air plane or helicopter i asked my wife if she saw it and what the heck is that she looked out my window and also saw it and made a joke that it was a ufo but as i keep looking at it that didn't seem so crazy as we stopped at the stop sign by are house it was still there just hovering maybe about the size of a nickel at arms distance i have never seen anything like this before we often have air planes and helicopters flying over i know what they look like and sound like and this was neither of those things we went home and that was the end of my sighting
content.summary: Saw a orange red light just hovering in the sky

content.detailedDescription: I am not the witness to this event but am reporting it for my grandfather.  he called me on my cell phone at 11:00pm december 28th 2013.  he said that some activity was going on.  he has security cameras and at that time he was reveiwing them for activity that he witnessed at 10:00pm.  he told me that he woke up because his dogs were barking.  he woke up and went staraight to the cameras.  he said he didnt see anything so he rewound the camera to see what may have disrupted them . that is when he saw lights on the top of his house.  like something traveled from the south to northwest direction over the house.  the lights were very bright and swift.  the whole event lasted one minute.  as soon as the lights moved the camera turned back to the same gray color.
content.summary: We are not sure where these light cames from? we tried to recreat it but my grandfather has a tall fence, my headlights could not reach over the fence?

content.detailedDescription:
My father lives in lynwood ca nfear the sheriffs jail. he called me in a confused state. he mentioned that he saw a bright orange oval shaped object on 12.31.13 at 10:31pm.  he also says the object was coming from the western direction heading east. he says the object was extremly bright nnad that anyone looking up at the stars that night could not have missed it!! he was certain that it was not a helicopter from the sheriffs station or an airplane approaching the run way! he said, that the ufo was coming from the west, than stops for a second and than shot up in the sky and that the birghtness coming off the object turned off just as quick as someone turning off a light  switch.. at first my father thought he was seeing things but than realized he was observing it for about 4 minutes until it shot up in the air.  you see my father is a takes care of my granfather and goes out to the back yard and enjoys watching the planes pass by the backyard. so he is use dto seeing airplanes/helicopters fly by. but to hear his voice was very convincing...

- why was this not on the news / radio???
- does the air traffic control report this to the media???
content.flightPath: Stationary,Hovering then path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: Bright orange oval. object was extremly bright in color. difficult to see actual shape and features

content.detailedDescription:
Object appeared above neighborhood. i estimate it was about 1/2 mile away and completely silent. the flight path was heading east in the northeast sky and was hardly straight moving approximately 70 mph. it's path was jagged (straight line, but many sudden small redirections). the light was bright. in the photos, the ambient light is given by a corner street lamp. the ufo light was bright enough to appear in the picture, even though the street lamp was flooding the picture with light.
at the end of the 1.5 minute event, the light grew dim and then it ascended at a speed of approx. 300+ mph.

living near an air force base, i see military craft often. this was unlike anything i have seen before. being unable to identify the object, by the strictest definition, this was a ufo.
content.summary: Orange glowing object

content.detailedDescription:
I live in south eastern poland (about 70 miles from the border with ukraine). on jan 1 2014, a few minutes after midnight my 14 year old son and i went outside our house to see and hear fireworks (new year celebration). as we were looking at the sky, i noticed a red light, brighter than the brightest star, moving across the sky in the direction of north. i showed it to my son and noted that it seemed to be moving much faster than jet planes. we heard no sounds but the night was quite noisy due to the fireworks our neighbors and others in the area were playing with. after the light passed us and we were looking at it facing north, it disappeared about 45 degrees above the horizon.

i was surprised mostly by the speed of the object and the first explanation that came to my mind was a rocket launched from ukraine.

as soon as the light disappeared we noticed another, identical red light over the south-western horizon moving north north-west. it was also fast. it was coming from the same direction.

our attention switched from fireworks to the strange, red lights. we kept seeing more and more of the lights going either north or north-west, all moving faster than jet-planes and all coming from the same point south-east. they appeared pretty regularly, but at one point we saw 3 of them at the same time in the sky.

around 00:30 we went back home and i asked my wife to come out to see the light. it was the last of the red lights that i saw that night (i waited awhile after that but didn't see any more of the lights). between about 00:10 and 00:30 we saw probably 10 or 12 of those objects.

even though we didn't see the shape of the objects and they were moving evenly across the sky, the brightness and the speed were very unusual. it made such an impression on me that for the next few hours i kept watching the news channel, expecting to hear about mysterious explosions in western europe or in america. obviously i am relieved no such events were reported, but i am still very curious what it was.

i should probably add that i don't drink alcohol (religion) and i don't believe that aliens can reach our planet (i guess i should say i don't believe in ufo's).
content.summary: About 10 bright red lights flew faster than jet planes.

content.detailedDescription:
I live in northern california not too far from san francisco. on 12/31/13 at approx 8:00 pm i saw what initially appeared to be a large orange 

burning object, high up in the northeastern sky  . i had my sunroof open, had just parked my car in front of a restaurant, turned to converse with 

my son who was sitting in the passenger seat and  this object caught my eye. for the past few months i had been witnessing strange out of place 

and unusually bright objects in the night sky that had peaked my interest enough to have caused me to purchased some good binnoculars and it 

just so happens that i keep them handy in my vehicle and  not taking my eyes off of "it" i reached for the familiar spot and pulled them out. it was 

a blazing orange colored glow, getting brighter as the glow area increased in size .It was something big i watched it get even bigger with my 

naked eyes as i raised my binoculars saying "that is not a plane it looks as if it is something big and on fire. i  took one fast look before quickly 

handed them to my (adult) son saying omg you have to look at this thing . he rolled his eyes and turned in his seat( this was not the first time i 

had asked his opinion on an object of my interest in the night sky)  what does this look like to you? as he is tall he held them up and out of the 

sun roof and  he looked at the object through them, asking me at one point to assist him in keeping them as steady as possible (so i used the 

edge of the sunroof to brace my right hand and the held the right side of the binnoculars steady with my extended fingers) excitement on my 

part was mounting because he didn't hand them right back to me saying "it's nothing"  as was often the case.  he said nothing and he continued 

to look.   i started to ask questions " what is it, its not a plane. is it a plane. is it on fire, are those flames,? he said "it definatly doesn't look like a 

plane but there... is fire". i said "i knew it was on fire, what is it, what does it look like, does it look like it's getting bigger,do you think it's part of 

the comet debris, or a maybe a meteor ... it kind of looks like...(i was going to say an asteroid but instead i said.)  is it coming  at us..Do you think 

it is aimed this way, is it going to hit us maybe, do you think it might hit near to us ? then i stopped as he turned to me  i grabbed the binnoculars 

and started to focus them while looking up to calculate the positioning and angle i could see the glow was fading. he said "it looks like its on fire 

but it looks more like fire from  "friction" thinking he was dismissing the event i said "friction? how do you know its friction. how do you even 

know what fiction looks like"?  he responded "because i've seen friction before" i said "you mean like.. maybe from entering the atmosphere kind 

of friction?" he said "possibly"  i raised the binnoculars i looked through the glasses it was hard to find (at first) as it was no longer bright and 

blazing nor orange, the fire was almost out. luckily small portions of it were sizzling on rear facing end. i found it just as the last embers were 

extinguishing. i watched it come closer and closer  i could now see the object  clearly it was in front of me and i was now facing forward in my 

seat but the image was still somewhat blurry and faint and  it was in a tumble, turning this way and that, end over end, and it continued tumbling 

almost as if in slow motion,  my impression at the time was it appeared to be a rock that was somehow uniform and resembling a cube.  it was 

square ..Leaning slightly towards rectangular, but the corners  were curved/rounded. the surface of it was smooth but not flat  what i saw  was 

gray in color...And this is the strange part  i saw a big darker gray circle on one of the sides as it turned to face me, and in some way it  seemed 

sort of transparent like an illusion at this point  i kept it in my sight through the binoculars  and i said to my son, what the hell is that? he said he 

could barely see it now with the naked eye and he was trying (as it turned out unsuccessfully )to take a photo with his phone  i watched it and saw 

the circle one more time before the cube shaped rock heading southwest disappeared  behind the restaurant building directly in front of me.
content.summary: Blazing orange flames/fire/friction high in the sky,out of which tumbled a gray(transparent?Rectangular) cube shaped object with slightly rounded corners.While tumbling end over end it slowly rotated & i saw darker gray circle on at least one of its sides

content.detailedDescription: I saw unusually bright orange oblong blip in western sky similar to mars sighting but much brighter and slightly elongated while driving home from work from santa rosa, ca to sebastopol, ca.  i thought it was just mars or another planet but it was very unusually bright and specifically caught my eye because it kept appearing elongated.  i was driving at the time so i could not get a very good look but it wasn't so significant that i thought it was a ufo at the time.  i was sure it was a planet but had never seen one so bright or appear lengthened.  i also thought for a minute it was plane coming toward me but kept looking to see if it changed shape or moved light a plane does when it flied toward you but it didn't.  it wasn't until i watched a local california news broadcast that i learned that objects or these objects had been spotted by many others all over the state on new years eve.
content.summary: Unusually bright orange oblong blip in western sky similar to mars sighting but much brighter and slightly elongated

content.detailedDescription: I was driving north down shaver with a friend. my car radio reception went out. as we came to the intersection of edgebrook and fairmont, we saw cars stopped in the middle of the road and people out of their cars pointing up in the air. when i looked up i was shocked to see this massive ship to the  northeast of the intersection it was over a shopping center off of almeda genoa and fairmont and was big enough to be over some of the neighborhood behind the shopping center. ..It had either 6 or 8 portals on the bottom of the craft and it had no lights that i could see we stood there for a few minutes ..I noticed a really small craft coming from the south-from the direction of ellington air force base- i saw a small port open up- the ship went in, then clouds starting to form around the ship then it shot straight up at a pace that made it look like it disappeared. ..I saw the cloud dissipate and kind of follow the ship straight up..We all looked at each other in disbelief got in our cars and left ..I was very scared so scared i took my friend home went straight home and stayed in my room for a week...The object was slowly turning counterclockwise and made no noise just a swoosh as it took off...I swear that this happened..I don't like to talk about it because when i do people think i'm lying the ship was very big i would guess 3000 feet in diameter i don't have a way to send you a picture but the ship looked kinda like the ships in v but the bottom looked like honeycomb cereal but no portal in the middle and they were deep portals...I hope others have come fourth and reported this to you as well...I'm not sure of the date but the year was 91 or 92
content.summary: We pulled up cars were blocking the intersection people were starting at it, it was huge -something small flew up to it clouds formed around it and shot straight up

content.detailedDescription:
1 stepped outside on my 2nd floor deck for some air.
2 movement
3 very large bird.
4 - 6 below.

i was on my balcony looking west from rancho bernardo california, toward the hills above the neighborhood called westwood. the back ground hills are hills separating north county east from north county west and the coast. something caught my eye as flying toward me below the horizon of the hill. at first glance, and being after dark, i first thought it was an unusually large bird with white tipped wings, but one of the objects changed direction and began to get further away from the other, making it clear that it was not a bird, and getting my full attention. their distance was about half way across the valley, or 1 to 2 miles and level with my line of sight looking toward the hill. they began to glide north and increased altitude just slightly above the horizon. one object again began moving ahead and bit faster than the other object. with the light of the horizon now behind the crafts, i began to get my depth of field and could see the two objects were moving north at an extremely fast rate of speed. in fact all of their movements were incredible fast but also abnormally smooth and steady. they continued to remain between my location and the hills, so their distance was less than two miles away during most of the siting. their altitude continued to be much lower than the ceiling would be for any airplanes in the area. even a helicopter would not fly so low unless it was going to land or drop water on a fire. although these were clearly not helicopters. 

i have never seen a ufo before and there was no possibility that these were airplanes or anything of earthly origin. they were not very large, but they were not extremely small like the orbs occasionally described either. they were moving unusually smoothly and at a high rate of speed even as they began to increase altitude, as if there was no resistance or effort at all involved, and the moved far faster than any aircraft we have and making no sound at all. being so close, there should have been some sound. the movement was much more like gliding, only at an extremely high rate of speed. just after the forward craft began to distance its self from the craft in the rear, they both accelerated and disappeared in a streak heading north. 

the light omitted from these craft was steady and constant, white or light gray in color with no blinking or other colorations. the craft themselves were dark. perhaps black, dark gray or shadowy, and the exact shape was impossible to make out with any certainty, although against the might horizon opposite from the moon, they appeared to be oval in shape. the lights were much dimmer than i would have guessed from descriptions that i have heard of ufo sightings in the past and even in comparison to other aircraft in the area that were much higher and further away. due to the flight path of planes moving south from los angeles, there were several airplanes in the area, although none in the direct path north, south or west of the craft, and again, all were much further away at much higher altitudes. the sighting lasted roughly 20-40 seconds. i doubt very seriously that i was the only one to see these.
content.summary: Two dark, low altitude objects, less than two miles away, moving east then separating and accelerating north at a miraculous rate of speed.

content.detailedDescription: My wife and i stepped outside onto our back yard deck to have a cigarette just before 10:30 pm new years eve. our back yard is situated facing due north. i happened to look up to see if the stars were out yet since i enjoy star gazing when ever possible. i noticed the two bright star like objects (#1 and #2) in the north western sky, at approx. 35 (#2) and 45 (#1) deg above the horizon.  the left most "star" (#2) was positioned at approx. 8:00 o'clock from the right one (#1). what surprised me was that they were identical in size,light coloration, intensity and were non-moving (their apparent size remained constant). i turned and asked my wife if  the two stars were red or was my eye sight failing me. she confirmed the coloration and we kept watching in awe. for some reason my gaze started to wander and i caught sight of another "star" (#3)of the same size,coloration and intensity as the other two but this one was moving in a uniform arced vector from a 15 deg point of first sight above the horizon in a nw and vertical arced trajectory till it was positioned at approx. 30 deg above the horizon and at 6:30 o'clock from the first right most "star" (#1). when the third "star" reached its location it just stopped and the left most one (#2) started to grow smaller until we couldn't see it any more,this took about 30 sec. just as the left one disappeared out of sight the two remaining started to grow smaller until both disappeared from sight, again this took about 30 sec. it appeared that the three "stars" had traveled in a perfect trajectory away from us since they just grew smaller in size with no wavering or erratic flight until they were out of sight.
content.flightPath: Stationary,Straight-line path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: My first observation was of two identically sized "stars" yellow center and orange red perimeter

content.detailedDescription: In the backseat of a car on newyears a couple hours after midnight get lucky with a lady-friend ;) and all of the sudden we both seen this bright orange light star making its way across the sky too fast, slow enough to watch it for about 5-10 minutes make its way across the sky the whole time we were watching it and couldnt figure out what it was, we thought it may have been a chinese lanturn or something but it couldnt have been it stayed bright and went uup into and past the clouds which is when we could no longer see it. the girl i was with recorded it, but i dont think i can aquire the video
content.summary: In the backseat of a car on newyears a couple hours after midnight.

content.detailedDescription:
1-i was in the backyard of my house.
2-looking to the sky.
3-ufo
4-3 orange lights in triangle formation.
5-3 normal,is not frist time.
content.summary: 3 orange lights in triangle formation.

content.detailedDescription:
On the 28 august 2012 @ approx 2130 hrs i was sitting in my back yard in the east end of hamilton when i observed (two) what looked light orange coloured orbs. they were the size of a star travelling in a north to south direction. they had no aircraft markings or anti collision lights there were no contrails or sound coming from these objects. they travelled parallel to each other then closed in on one other, one then circled around the other then moved away at that point a flash of light like a static electric spark came between them. these objects kept travelling towards the south where i lost sight over the neighbours trees.
 
directions - north to south 
 
weather- clear sky, light to moderate wind, moon was out.
 
descriptors-did not look like or have any  characteristics of any aircraft, helicopter or satellite that i have ever heard or seen.
content.summary: Unknown objects over the city of hamilton ontario

content.detailedDescription:
This report is being filed by the kansas state director on behalf of the husband and wife witnesses.

wife:
taking kids to christmas party. two of her own kids and one other, a friend of theirs. was at corner of se westedge & se lakeshore blvd in topeka.

saw what she thought was low-flying plane. realized it wasn���t a plane. straight line of solid white and red lights that blinked. no sound. travelled in a line from s to nw. seemed very large. followed for 4 minutes to se 29th & se westedge, then it veered to the northwest toward a populated area. then she lost sight of the object.

was talking to husband on her cell phone to inform him of the sighting. told him to go outside and look.

then about 8:45 pm she was headed west on se 29th street saw a bright white ball of light where the object had been. lost sight of light due to trees. apparent size of light was golf ball to baseball size at arm���s length.

both parties observed extensive helicopter traffic in the area on the 19th & 20th during evening hours. one helicopter was shining its light horizontally into the sky.


husband:
went outside with his son and took video at home. observed the lights for about five minutes. lights moved from nne to the sw. moved along semi-circle line in a steady motion. disappeared over the horizon. the lights seemed to be on an object that was flying horizontally.
content.summary: Observed large shape with solid white and blinking red lights

content.detailedDescription: I was at twin peaks in sf when i noticed the orbs hovering over sf
content.summary: 5 orbs over sf @ midnight exactly hovered then seperated and slowly dissapeared

content.detailedDescription:
Setting: 
neighborhood in a forested mountain area about 10 km separated from town. dark sky lots of stars and no clouds.

situation:
there were firecrackers going off occasionally around the neighborhood and even though our sector was quiet i went outside and walked down the street.
 
incident:
while waling outside a few houses down, i saw a light through the trees (ponderosas); yellow/orange mixed. indistinct.
i moved to the far side of the road to get a little more perspective and move the object higher into the thinner upper pines from my perspective for less obstructed view. 
description of the object is spherical throughout, but changes as it flew. while low/large it was a fuzzy orb with a nucleus in the upper left area from my position. at this point it was a yellow/orange color. as it ascended, it shrunk in size, became sharper, and transitioned from yellow/orange to orange, to dark orange, and then dark red. no flashing lights. no sound. 

[*i will insert my assumptions as this report progresses.]

[since the aircraft was obviously low, i initially assumed it was a helicopter with some sort of forward looking light. but the light was not a beam as far as i could see. but at the moment it didn���t occur to me that there was no rotor, propeller or jet noise.]

the object���s size was about a third of a full moon at first. it seemed to be approaching my direction because it grew for about 10 seconds and seemed to hover towards my vicinity.
 
then it started to rise, slowly at first. 

it was right around midnight 12/31 and there were occasional firecrackers going off, and i could hear some distant boom fireworks from the town miles away.

[as the object rose, i shifted my thinking (i was still very banal and casual at this point), that this was now a fancy backyard firework with a parachute, sort of like a military flare, which i have seen before. if that was the case, it would have been 1/4 mile away or closer. plus, normally, you would hear people cheering its launch. aside from that, but why does it keep rising?]

at this point i realized ���wait a second, this isn���t normal?���

as it rose, its shape became more solid, switched from fuzzy yellow/orange to orange and finally solid red.

it gained speed as it rose and arced northwest until it disappeared, still increasing speed. 

it is difficult to assess speed and elevation because i could not tell how large the object was.
content.summary: Yellow orb hovering, then changing outline and color as it started rising. then dark red until it rose and arced towards nw direction as it picked up speed and faded towards nw from my position.

content.detailedDescription: Anyone else see strange lights around midnight last night? my kids and i were watching fireworks from our deck when 3 reddish multicolored lights slowly moved in a line formation from the north towards downtown vegas (we were facing east) and i would estimate they were about a mile high. that would put them over the lv speedway and nellis afb. my first thought was they were blackhawks flying into nellis. then they went from a horizontal line into a large stationary triangle. there were no flashing lights, it was more like a shimmer. weird and hard to describe. then 2 more slowly headed towards them in a line from the north, but faded away as they approached the group. after several minutes, they slowly moved toward the east in unison, and then faded out. we were like, what the hell are those? it was cold, so we all went back in. after a few minutes, i looked out again and saw another one by itself high over downtown vegas. i ran to get my binoculars, and spent the next few minutes staring at this thing. no distinguishable shape, only a single point of light that was continually changing colors. to the naked eye it appeared mostly red. as i looked at it, it finally moved slowly toward the east and faded, much like the space station fades as it enters the earth's shadow. i googled and found this website last night, but there we very few and sporadic reports. now there are similar sightings, all over the country, all around the same time! i don't know if there little green pilots, but i sure as hell can't identify them!
content.flightPath: Straight-line path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: Several strange lights moving in formation over vegas new years eve 2014.

content.detailedDescription:
Went out to see if anything going on for new year's, night quiet, saw red lights in a triangle pattern coming slowly from the east along galveston island.  watched for about five minutes as it slowly turned to nw direction and was eventually covered by low clouds.  heard nothing until a helicopter came near after the sighting.  this happened at 11:30 p.M.  

my boyfriend had gone out initially and noticed five lights approaching in a pattern and called to me to come outside.  when i got outside there were three lights in a triangle pattern that remained steady as on one object with no change in the distance between any of the lights.  i thought i heard a low hum but not sure if that was the helicopter that came closer after the sighting.  there is a small airport on the island with frequent helicopters flying.
content.summary: Five lights decreased to three in triangle, slow movement, no sound

content.detailedDescription: 630 pm new yrs day  red orange pulsing  basketball size  orb - was horrified with fear=  moving around side to side and circle same time  then moved slowly  hovered over  a home  maybe 2 min  then left toward north -- first saw it was moving very strangely was locked into it  didn't appear to be that far above the trees- seemed  to start moving toward me  slowly no sound  very bright  was in shock--  not giving any personal info  just wondering if some1 else  in lancaster county saw anything  close to lititz area            the phone numbers and email r made up  not going to let any1 know who  i am  don't want to be the town nut case
content.summary: Red orange orb  movement was unreal  horrified

content.detailedDescription: Sitting on the beach with my girlfriend brining in the new year when i noticed 3 orbs glowing red orange floating in the sky slowly forming a triangle shape lasted about 4 min and then disappeared
content.summary: Orbs in sky forming triangle shape

content.detailedDescription:
I was behind my house testing my rc racecar airplanes fly near my home on a regular basis the airport is about 2 miles from my home i looked up and i saw the object i figured it was an airplane possibly flying high but the sky was cloudy no stars and no way of to see high up because of the cloudy sky the object had no running lights of any kind and made no sound the object was below the clouds and was the only light in the sky i am an astronomer by hobby when i was younger about 12 im 44 now i saw something very similar
looking at it kind of took me by surprise i went into my home and then went out to look again and this time the object was in the sky still to the north but further away it spooked me at first because of my past memory but then i wanted to find it again and try to get a better look to figure what it might be but it was gone by this time i believe it was the same object like i said i was when i was 12 year old
content.summary: Testing my rc racecar standing behind my home sighted moving slowly in the sky

content.detailedDescription: 5u
content.summary: Look up in the sky and seen a fireball it was moving in a straight path north moving possibly 100 to 200 miles per hour

content.altitude: 500 Feet or Less, Over 500 Feet (under cloudcover)
content.detailedDescription:
For new years i watch local fireworks and stars. just after 12 am my time people of neighboring zip codes were celebrating new years morning, i watched the fire works and 1/2 a sky of stars. the other half was covered by thick white clouds. it was so quite i could hear traffic from 270, and 55, along with what others were shooting off. after a few minutes 1 very bright orb was viable through easterly trees. it was moving fast and seemed to pulse red/orange to almost white. it was about 2-3 times the size of the lowest flying plan i've seen in the area. so bright the color was the only thing viable. i couldn't see through it so i assume it was solid, or emitting so much light no background star was viable. the speed was incredibly fast too. it covered the flight path about 3-4 times faster than planes that fly in the area. 

   shortly after realizing it was not a firework exploding, and traveled too fast to be a plane i notice a 2n'd one coming from a southern  to north, north eastern direction. both were below clouds, altitude unknown. similar size (brightness), same colors, same type of pulse. synchronized unknown. they were wonderful in color, with out sound, left no trail in the sky, made no beam, no landing, no stop.
   after the first one arrived at the same intersecting level it suddenly changed to the same direction the second one was headed. they both flew that way until they were out of sight blocked by tress, or objects on the horizon. only took 1ish minutes for them to be visible and gone. i'm not a good judge of time when i'm not paying attention, but they were there and gone quick... maybe less than 1 minute. i knew they'd be out of sight before i could fetch a camera so i just enjoyed seeing what ever it may be.

   i watch single prop, double prop, passenger jets, helicopters, and military fighters& choppers, and i know it was none of the above common types that. i can hear choppers from miles away before seeing it, same with planes at night. there was no sound, brilliant intense light in an orb shape, that was steady and didn't flicker or flash. to even come close to how bright this light was it would take a chopper with a search light opened up, fly low, and even then it would have cast a beam of light viable in such pitch black night sky. i've worked in theater so seen plenty of lights. i could also say the colors were slightly different between center part and outer. but no descriptive words i have would do it justice.  this thing cast no beam of light, but only seemed to be an orb of independent light. no sound, no beam of light, just a steady cycle of colors. would be interesting to recreate it with cg, but i'm not even sure that would be done right... it was unique compared to anything seen thus far.
content.summary: 1 orb moving east to west, changed direction to almost parallel with: 1 orb moving from south to northern direction just after 12 am new years

content.detailedDescription: I was at a christmas eve party and my friend went outside to say goodbye to his sisters, and then they all witnessed something in the sky and called for everyone to see.  i ran outside and looked up to see 3 orange lights in a triangle shape, rather large, slowly moving.  there were low clouds in the night sky and some of the lights were hidden behind clouds at times.   5 witnesses saw it and none of us knew what it was.  it made no noise.  eventually after about a minute i got cold and decided to go inside, because the cloud cover increased and i could no longer see the 3 orange lights.  it was unclear whether it was 3 different objects flying in a pattern, or 1 large triangular object.
content.summary: 3 orange lights in a triangle shape were seen but not heard, slowly moving above in a triangular shape

content.detailedDescription:
New year's day, 12:30am roughly, a friend and i are walking in the front yard of a nye house party heading to the front porch, facing northwest. at about a 50 degree angle from the horizon, a green ball of light appeared and within one second the light eminated a flash of green that lit up the entire sky. fireworks had been previously in the area, with the last explosion occurring a few minutes prior. there was no sound within 1 minute before nor 1 minute after the green light appeared and disappeared, respectively. 
the other party-goers on the porch witnessed the sky light up green but did not see the original green light. the witnesses in the back yard saw the flash but did not see the source.
content.summary: Green ball of light that flashed to highlight the entire sky, no sound.

content.detailedDescription: Was on the ocean city board walk for the new years fireworks of 2014. as we were all walking to the end of the boardwalk, there was a crowd of people all going, i looked behind me and saw on the shoreline, up in the air about 5 or more huge red-orange lights flying in a straight line. it was weird right then and there. the light itself was weird. also the formation. i waited by the music pier building and they all eventually made there way right above it, towards the side of it and they all started to just move out of line and form nothing really..Just completely got out of line and huddled near each other. then they all started to dim but one stayed just a little bit, i started to point and say look to show my mom but everyone just kept walking like zombies to the end of the boardwalk..It was out in the open for everyone to see but i don't know how many cared to stop and watch. it was decently close to us, not far at all. no noise. my mom and myself watched them reappear, but they didn't stay long as they faded away again. not reappearing after that, that i noticed. because after the lights went out we continued down the boardwalk. in all honesty, i don't know if it was some weird planes or ufo..But it sure as hell looked like a ufo. my first feelings when i saw it was basically,"what the hell is that?"... then once we saw it up close and doing what it did, it just felt unreal, and i started to even get really scared. it's weird to think we are alone, but after seeing that, since we aren't use to it, it makes you realize reality is scary. what bothered me is that there was tons of people on the boardwalk, it stayed kind of quiet, and no one really said a thing about those huge lights that were obviously like, look! look at me!!I didn't get to film it, i didn't even think to film it, i was to busy staring. to be honest, that night was very eerie. i think no one really cared and thought they were planes but they just didn't look like anything i have ever seen before.
content.flightPath: Straight-line path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: 5 or more bright lights flying over ocean shore line in straight line. in ocean city nj

content.detailedDescription: About 12:20 a.M. after ringing in the new year i was putting our kids to bed.  we looked out their window which faces east to watch the fireworks.  we were watching them and i noticed my husband below us in the yard as he was checking on our dogs.  he was also looking east towards the wasatch mountain (a bit south of mount olympus).  as i looked up to see what he was looking at i saw a handful of orange lights.  at first i thought it was a bunch of small wildfires on the mountain started by fireworks but snow covered the mountains.  i then realized these were too high to be on the mountain.  the lights would move around slowly and deliberately.  some would fade out and others ascended upwards.  it scared my boys and i was very unnerved myself.   i opened their window and hollered to my husband asking him if he was seeing what i was seeing.  indeed he was.   i grabbed my phone to take pictures but the lights were too faint at that point to be picked up on the phone.  i'm a big skeptic of stories of aliens visiting earth or ufos but there is no logical explanation for this.  even my very level-headed husband is mystified.  i stopped watching when i realized my reaction was scaring my kids.  i tried to convince them it was hot air balloons or something watching fireworks and their flames were going off and on.  we closed the blinds and i put them to bed.   i'm very unnerved by the whole thing and wish there was a logical answer.
content.summary: Saw 6 or 7 orange-colored glowing lights hovering then slowly moving and disappearing.  others slowly ascended and joined others.

content.detailedDescription: We were sitting in our living room on new years eve 2013-2014 waiting for our neighbors to start going crazy with celebration. at 23:59 pt many firecrackers, sky rockets and cherry bombs were heard along with a couple of loud muzzle-loaders and a couple of 9mm/22 cal sounds. my wife kept telling me to look out my north-facing window at the rockets that were exploding in our view from our second-flooor apartment. i looked several times noticing the bright stationary lights through the left corner of our window. several more fireworks went off and about 2 minutes later at 00:01 my wife said "what is that?"  i said "what?" i looked and saw two columns of lights glowing low red-orange hanging in the distance through the center of the north window (a sliding glass door actually). as i watched, the lights altered their formation and formed a wedge shape. then straight columns and then i went to get a camera but my wife observed them changed to an inverted y formation and  then flicker and fade out of site.
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Path with directional change
content.summary: Observed a formation of lights two columns hovering then moving east then dimming

content.detailedDescription: I was in the backyard with my dogs and saw this bright red/orange light appear in the sky and was quickly moving. it was moving in a straight line pattern. i thought it was a plane at first but it was moving too fast and flying too low. it made no noise.  it was round and almost looked like it was on fire. the house flood lights were on so i ran the length of the house, which is not that long a distance to see it on the darker side of the yard and it had disappeared. i felt a little un-nerved.
content.summary: Saw bright red/orange flying object appear quickly and was gone quickly.

content.detailedDescription:
My family came outside on new years evening and
noticed a bright light that looked like a redish orange star 
that was moving slowly from north to south east then it began flickering and appeared to be 
fading out and the disappeared. there was no clouds at all. then another one appeared and
the same thing happened again. this lasted about five minutes and then
it was over.
content.summary: Two reddish orange lights flickering like a star but moving slowly from north to south sky then light slowly fades away
